sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>criminal</radical>'s <radical>heart</radical> will always be <kanji>sad</kanji>. No one chooses a life of crime if they're happy. And even if they seem like they're doing fine on the outside, deep down they're really sad.
meaningInfo: Imagine watching a criminal after he's done stealing from a bank. He's all alone. He stops throwing the money around. And cries. So so sad.
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>sad</kanji> feelings fill the criminal's body with <reading>he</reading>at (<ja>ひ</ja>). This heat spreads and radiates out. If you walk next to them on the street, you'll feel the sad heat floating by you.
readingInfo: Imagine being so sad that your entire body fills with heat. That heat even makes squiggly heat lines pop out above and around you.
